required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ICI-VPH: Impact of HPV Immunisation Schedules Against HPV
clinical_study.official_title: ICI-VPH: Impact Des Calendriers d'Immunisation Contre Les HPV

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec, CHU de Québec

collaborator.agency: Quebec Ministry of Health and Social Services

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec, CHU de Québec

brief_summary.textblock:
This randomised clinical trial aims to determine whether an immunization schedule comprising two doses of Gardasil administered six months apart is non-inferior to a schedule comprising three doses administered at 0, 6 and 60 months for the prevention of HPV-16 and HPV-18 infections that persist for at least six months, up to ten years after the initial vaccination.
The study hypothesis is that the two-dose schedule would offer similar protection as that of a three-dose schedule against persistent HPV-16/18 infections.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titres of antibodies and seropositivity for HPV types 6, 11, 16 and 18

arm_group.description: The participants who have already received 2 doses of the quadrivalent HPV vaccine (0, 6 months schedule) 5 years before recruitment will not receive an additional dose.

The participants will receive a 3rd dose of quadrivalent HPV vaccine at recruitment visit, which is 5 years after having received two doses of vaccine given 6 months apart in grade 4 (0, 6, 60 months Schedule)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having received two doses of Gardasil in 2008-2009, 2009-2010 or 2010-2011 according to 0, 6 months Schedule (+- 1 month)
- Resident of the regions chosen for the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Being considered immunosuppressed at time of vaccination (9-10 years-old) or at recruitment visit
- Being pregnant at recruitment visit

facility.name: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec, CHU de Québec

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec, CHU de Québec
